entry.summary: ...WARM DRY AND BREEZY THROUGH WEDNESDAY... .Breezy winds and low humidity levels will be in place for the next several days with afternoon and early evening being the most impactful periods. entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 02 at 3:40PM CDT until August 03 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...High waves and strong currents are expected as waves build to 3 to 7 ft, highest north of Sturgeon Bay. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Door, Kewaunee and Manitowoc Counties.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 4:25PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton.... Scattered thunderstorms with frequent lightning, gusty winds, and heavy rain move into Western Wyoming this evening. * WHAT...Scattered thunderstorms with frequent lightning and heavy rain. Localized flooding is possible. Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 4:02PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall from thunderstorms is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Wyoming, including West Yellowstone and Madison Junction. * WHEN...Until 700 PM MDT.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued August 02 at 11:03AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE WYOMING AIR QUALITY DIVISION HAS ISSUED AN AIR QUALITY ALERT FOR WILDFIRE SMOKE IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... The following message is transmitted in collaboration with the Wyoming Department of Environmental Quality, Air Quality Division, and the Wyoming Department of Health. * WHAT...Air Quality Alert for Wildfire Smoke.
